question_stem: The line \(y = 3x - 1\) intersects the x-axis at point B.

parts.question_text: Write down the coordinates of B.
parts.solution_text: The x-intercept occurs when \(y = 0\). Substituting \(y = 0\) into the equation of the line gives \(0 = 3x - 1\).  Solving for \(x\), we have \(3x = 1\), so \(x = \frac{1}{3}\). Thus, the coordinates of B are \((\frac{1}{3}, 0)\).
